title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.50-52 | 24-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Nakula and Sahadeva the younger brothers of the King and also Satyaki Arjuna the personality of God in Lord Shri Krishna who is the son of Devaki and the ladies and others all unanimously agreed with the King
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verses to be discussed (SB 1.7.50-52) and begins explaining verse 50, focusing on the agreement of various figures with Yudhishthira's support of Draupadi's decision regarding Ashwatthama.

segments.key_quote: here practically everyone is mentioned except one person that is Bhima.
segments.summary: The speaker continues discussing verse 50, emphasizing the support for Draupadi's decision and noting the absence of Bhima's agreement, setting up the discussion of verse 51.

segments.key_quote: Bhima however disagreed with them and recommended killing this culprit who in an angry mood had murdered sleeping children for no purpose and for neither his nor his master's interest.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces and explains verse 51, highlighting Bhima's disagreement and his reasons for wanting to kill Ashwatthama, emphasizing the heinous nature of Ashwatthama's actions and their lack of purpose.

segments.key_quote: When somebody becomes angry, then they lose their sense of discrimination. Anger actually makes a person lose his intelligence.
segments.summary: The speaker continues explaining Bhima's perspective from verse 51, focusing on the role of anger in Ashwatthama's actions and Bhima's conclusion that Ashwatthama deserves to be killed.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is looking at Arjuna, his friend, his dear friend and Krishna is now going to speak something very very significant to Arjuna.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces verse 52, describing Krishna's reaction to the conflicting views of Bhima and Draupadi and setting up Krishna's upcoming advice to Arjuna.

The speaker explains why Krishna is referred to as Chaturbhuja (four-armed) in this verse, drawing on Shridhara Swami's commentary and discussing the relationship between Krishna and Narayana, as well as the spiritual realms of Vaikuntha and Krishnaloka.

segments.key_quote: So Krishna is looking at Arjuna and he is sympathizing therefore he is also smiling at Arjuna.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes the session by reiterating Arjuna's dilemma and Krishna's sympathetic understanding, preparing for the next verse where Krishna will offer guidance. The lecture ends with a thank you and Hare Krishna.
